Package chess

Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
chess.GameBoard
public class GameBoard extends Object
GameBoard class used as the game board of the chess object. Handles logic regarding the chess board.
Author:
DiegoCastellanos dac392, AbidAzad aa2177

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    GameBoard()
    takes no arguments, and initiates a chess board along with the correct initial pieces.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoard

      public GameBoard()
      takes no arguments, and initiates a chess board along with the correct initial pieces. the game board either contain and empty string "", or the a piece in the form Color and Type "bK"

  • Method Details

    • getPlayer

      public int getPlayer()
      returns integer as the player number
      Returns:
      player as an integer 1 for PLAYER_1 and -1 for PLAYER_2

    • printGameBoard

      public void printGameBoard()
      prints the gameboard to the console and decides the correct pattern for all empty spaces.

    • printHashMaps

      public void printHashMaps()
      debuging statement used for print black and white team pieces

    • blackMoveManager

      public int blackMoveManager(String in)
      driver for black team moves
      Parameters:
      in - instruction string
      Returns:
      valid move status; 0 for ERROR and 1 for CORRECT

    • whiteMoveManager

      public int whiteMoveManager(String in)
      driver for white team moves
      Parameters:
      in - instruction string
      Returns:
      valid move status; 0 for ERROR and 1 for CORRECT

    • regularMove

      public boolean regularMove(String in, HashMap<String,ChessPiece> allyTeam, HashMap<String,ChessPiece> enemyTeam)
      called by both whiteMoveManager and blackMoveManager, handles all actual logic for deciding moves.
      Parameters:
      in - input string
      allyTeam - hashmap pieces
      enemyTeam - hashmap pieces
      Returns:
      boolean denoting the semantics of the input and the validity of a move

    • safeMove

      public boolean safeMove(String in, HashMap<String,ChessPiece> safe2, HashMap<String,ChessPiece> safe)
      Should perform a move and check if the king is safe. Regardless, should return board back to what it was before returning.
      Parameters:
      in - input string
      safe2 - HashMap
      safe - HashMap
      Returns:
      boolean deciding whether a move is safe to be made
